title: betaDelta: Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
text: Generates confidence intervals standardized regression coefficients using delta method standard errors models fitted lm() described Yuan Chan (2011: http://doi.org/10.1007/s11336-011-9224-6) Jones Waller (2015: http://doi.org/10.1007/s11336-013-9380-y). description package code examples presented Pesigan, Sun, Cheung (2023: https://doi.org/10.1080/00273171.2023.2201277).

title: betaDelta: Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
text: can install CRAN release betaDelta : can install development version betaDelta GitHub :
code: install.packages("betaDelta") if (!require("remotes")) install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("jeksterslab/betaDelta")

title: betaDelta: Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
text: example, multiple regression model fitted using program quality ratings (QUALITY) regressand/outcome variable number published articles attributed program faculty members (NARTIC), percent faculty members holding research grants (PCTGRT), percentage program graduates received support (PCTSUPP) regressor/predictor variables using data set 1982 ratings 46 doctoral programs psychology USA (National Research Council, 1982). Confidence intervals standardized regression coefficients generated using BetaDelta() function betaDelta package following Yuan Chan (2011) Jones Waller (2015).
code: library(betaDelta) df <- betaDelta::nas1982

what: Fit the regression model using the lm() function.
title: betaDelta: Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
code: object <- lm(QUALITY ~ NARTIC + PCTGRT + PCTSUPP, data = df)

previous_headings: Example > Estimate the standardized regression slopes and the corresponding sampling covariance matrix.
title: betaDelta: Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
code: BetaDelta(object, type = "mvn", alpha = 0.05) ## Call: ## BetaDelta(object = object, type = "mvn", alpha = 0.05) ##  ## Standardized regression slopes with MVN standard errors: ##            est     se      t df     p   2.5%  97.5% ## NARTIC  0.4951 0.0759 6.5272 42 0.000 0.3421 0.6482 ## PCTGRT  0.3915 0.0770 5.0824 42 0.000 0.2360 0.5469 ## PCTSUPP 0.2632 0.0747 3.5224 42 0.001 0.1124 0.4141

previous_headings: Example > Estimate the standardized regression slopes and the corresponding sampling covariance matrix.
title: betaDelta: Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
code: BetaDelta(object, type = "adf", alpha = 0.05) ## Call: ## BetaDelta(object = object, type = "adf", alpha = 0.05) ##  ## Standardized regression slopes with ADF standard errors: ##            est     se      t df      p   2.5%  97.5% ## NARTIC  0.4951 0.0674 7.3490 42 0.0000 0.3592 0.6311 ## PCTGRT  0.3915 0.0710 5.5164 42 0.0000 0.2483 0.5347 ## PCTSUPP 0.2632 0.0769 3.4231 42 0.0014 0.1081 0.4184

title: betaDelta: Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
text: package can also used generate confidence intervals differences standardized regression coefficients.

what: Fit the regression model using the lm() function.
title: betaDelta: Example Using the DiffBetaDelta Function
code: object <- lm(QUALITY ~ NARTIC + PCTGRT + PCTSUPP, data = df)

previous_headings: Estimate the standardized regression slopes and the corresponding sampling covariance matrix.
title: betaDelta: Example Using the DiffBetaDelta Function
code: std_mvn <- BetaDelta(object, type = "mvn")

previous_headings: Estimate the standardized regression slopes and the corresponding sampling covariance matrix.
title: betaDelta: Example Using the DiffBetaDelta Function
code: std_adf <- BetaDelta(object, type = "adf")

what: Estimate differences of standardized regression slopes and the corresponding sampling covariance matrix.
title: betaDelta: Example Using the DiffBetaDelta Function
code: mvn <- DiffBetaDelta(std_mvn, alpha = 0.05) adf <- DiffBetaDelta(std_adf, alpha = 0.05)

previous_headings: Estimate differences of standardized regression slopes and the corresponding sampling covariance matrix.
title: betaDelta: Example Using the DiffBetaDelta Function
text: Summary results DiffBetaDelta().
code: summary(mvn) #> Call: #> DiffBetaDelta(object = std_mvn, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Difference between standardized regression coefficients with MVN standard errors: #>                   est     se      z      p    2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.1037 0.1357 0.7640 0.4449 -0.1623 0.3696 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.2319 0.1252 1.8524 0.0640 -0.0135 0.4773 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.1282 0.1227 1.0451 0.2960 -0.1123 0.3688 summary(adf) #> Call: #> DiffBetaDelta(object = std_adf, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Difference between standardized regression coefficients with ADF standard errors: #>                   est     se      z      p    2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.1037 0.1212 0.8555 0.3923 -0.1338 0.3411 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.2319 0.1181 1.9642 0.0495  0.0005 0.4633 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.1282 0.1215 1.0555 0.2912 -0.1099 0.3664

previous_headings: Estimate differences of standardized regression slopes and the corresponding sampling covariance matrix.
title: betaDelta: Example Using the DiffBetaDelta Function
text: Calculate differences standardized regression slopes.
code: coef(mvn) #>  NARTIC-PCTGRT NARTIC-PCTSUPP PCTGRT-PCTSUPP  #>      0.1036564      0.2318974      0.1282410 coef(adf) #>  NARTIC-PCTGRT NARTIC-PCTSUPP PCTGRT-PCTSUPP  #>      0.1036564      0.2318974      0.1282410

previous_headings: Estimate differences of standardized regression slopes and the corresponding sampling covariance matrix.
title: betaDelta: Example Using the DiffBetaDelta Function
text: Calculate sampling covariance matrix differences standardized regression slopes.
code: vcov(mvn) #>                NARTIC-PCTGRT NARTIC-PCTSUPP PCTGRT-PCTSUPP #> NARTIC-PCTGRT    0.018408653    0.009511262   -0.008897391 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP   0.009511262    0.015672035    0.006160773 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP  -0.008897391    0.006160773    0.015058164 vcov(adf) #>                NARTIC-PCTGRT NARTIC-PCTSUPP PCTGRT-PCTSUPP #> NARTIC-PCTGRT    0.014681407    0.006928651   -0.007752755 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP   0.006928651    0.013938955    0.007010303 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP  -0.007752755    0.007010303    0.014763058

what: Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
title: Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
text: Ivan Jacob Agaloos Pesigan 2023-07-01

title: Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
text: Generates confidence intervals standardized regression coefficients using delta method standard errors models fitted lm() described Yuan Chan (2011: http://doi.org/10.1007/s11336-011-9224-6) Jones Waller (2015: http://doi.org/10.1007/s11336-013-9380-y). description package code examples presented Pesigan, Sun, Cheung (2023: https://doi.org/10.1080/00273171.2023.2201277).

title: Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
text: can install CRAN release betaDelta : can install development version betaDelta GitHub :
code: install.packages("betaDelta") if (!require("remotes")) install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("jeksterslab/betaDelta")

title: Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
text: example, multiple regression model fitted using program quality ratings (QUALITY) regressand/outcome variable number published articles attributed program faculty members (NARTIC), percent faculty members holding research grants (PCTGRT), percentage program graduates received support (PCTSUPP) regressor/predictor variables using data set 1982 ratings 46 doctoral programs psychology USA (National Research Council, 1982). Confidence intervals standardized regression coefficients generated using BetaDelta() function betaDelta package following Yuan Chan (2011) Jones Waller (2015).
code: library(betaDelta) df <- betaDelta::nas1982

what: Fit the regression model using the lm() function.
title: Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
code: object <- lm(QUALITY ~ NARTIC + PCTGRT + PCTSUPP, data = df)

previous_headings: Example > Estimate the standardized regression slopes and the corresponding sampling covariance matrix.
title: Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
code: BetaDelta(object, type = "mvn", alpha = 0.05) #> Call: #> BetaDelta(object = object, type = "mvn", alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Standardized regression slopes with MVN standard errors: #>            est     se      t df     p   2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC  0.4951 0.0759 6.5272 42 0.000 0.3421 0.6482 #> PCTGRT  0.3915 0.0770 5.0824 42 0.000 0.2360 0.5469 #> PCTSUPP 0.2632 0.0747 3.5224 42 0.001 0.1124 0.4141

previous_headings: Example > Estimate the standardized regression slopes and the corresponding sampling covariance matrix.
title: Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
code: BetaDelta(object, type = "adf", alpha = 0.05) #> Call: #> BetaDelta(object = object, type = "adf", alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Standardized regression slopes with ADF standard errors: #>            est     se      t df      p   2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC  0.4951 0.0674 7.3490 42 0.0000 0.3592 0.6311 #> PCTGRT  0.3915 0.0710 5.5164 42 0.0000 0.2483 0.5347 #> PCTSUPP 0.2632 0.0769 3.4231 42 0.0014 0.1081 0.4184

title: Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
text: package can also used generate confidence intervals differences standardized regression coefficients.

title:
Estimate Standardized Regression Coefficients
and the Corresponding Sampling Covariance Matrix — BetaDelta
text: object Object class lm. type Character string. type = "mvn", use multivariate normal-theory approach. type = "adf", use asymptotic distribution-free approach. alpha Numeric vector. Significance level \(\alpha\).

title:
Estimate Standardized Regression Coefficients
and the Corresponding Sampling Covariance Matrix — BetaDelta
text: Returns object class betadelta list following elements: call Function call. args Function arguments. lm_process Processed lm object. gamma Asymptotic covariance matrix sample covariance matrix. acov Asymptotic covariance matrix standardized slopes. vcov Sampling covariance matrix standardized slopes. est Vector standardized slopes.

title:

text: Ivan Jacob Agaloos Pesigan

title:
Estimate Differences of Standardized Slopes
and the Corresponding Sampling Covariance Matrix — DiffBetaDelta
code: object <- lm(QUALITY ~ NARTIC + PCTGRT + PCTSUPP, data = nas1982) std <- BetaDelta(object) diff <- DiffBetaDelta(std) # Methods ------------------------------------------------------- print(diff) #> Call: #> DiffBetaDelta(object = std) #>  #> Difference between standardized regression coefficients with MVN standard errors: #>                   est     se      z      p   0.05%    0.5%    2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.1037 0.1357 0.7640 0.4449 -0.3428 -0.2458 -0.1623 0.3696 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.2319 0.1252 1.8524 0.0640 -0.1800 -0.0906 -0.0135 0.4773 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.1282 0.1227 1.0451 0.2960 -0.2755 -0.1878 -0.1123 0.3688 #>                 99.5% 99.95% #> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.4531 0.5501 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.5544 0.6438 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.4443 0.5320 summary(diff) #> Call: #> DiffBetaDelta(object = std) #>  #> Difference between standardized regression coefficients with MVN standard errors: #>                   est     se      z      p   0.05%    0.5%    2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.1037 0.1357 0.7640 0.4449 -0.3428 -0.2458 -0.1623 0.3696 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.2319 0.1252 1.8524 0.0640 -0.1800 -0.0906 -0.0135 0.4773 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.1282 0.1227 1.0451 0.2960 -0.2755 -0.1878 -0.1123 0.3688 #>                 99.5% 99.95% #> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.4531 0.5501 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.5544 0.6438 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.4443 0.5320 coef(diff) #>  NARTIC-PCTGRT NARTIC-PCTSUPP PCTGRT-PCTSUPP  #>      0.1036564      0.2318974      0.1282410  vcov(diff) #>                NARTIC-PCTGRT NARTIC-PCTSUPP PCTGRT-PCTSUPP #> NARTIC-PCTGRT    0.018408653    0.009511262   -0.008897391 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP   0.009511262    0.015672035    0.006160773 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP  -0.008897391    0.006160773    0.015058164 confint(diff, level = 0.95) #>                      2.5 %    97.5 % #> NARTIC-PCTGRT  -0.16226855 0.3695814 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP -0.01346652 0.4772614 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP -0.11226950 0.3687516
